<Link id="l02139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2139"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if this shuffle mask is a transpose mask.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2140"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Transpose vector masks transpose a 2xn matrix. They read corresponding</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2141"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// even- or odd-numbered vector elements from two n-dimensional source</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2142"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// vectors and write each result into consecutive elements of an</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2143"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// n-dimensional destination vector. Two shuffles are necessary to complete</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2144"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// the transpose, one for the even elements and another for the odd elements.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2145"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This description closely follows how the TRN1 and TRN2 AArch64</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2146"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// instructions operate.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2147"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2148"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For example, a simple 2x2 matrix can be transposed with:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2149"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2150"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   ; Original matrix</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2151"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   m0 = &lt; a, b &gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2152"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   m1 = &lt; c, d &gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2153"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2154"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   ; Transposed matrix</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02155" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2155"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   t0 = &lt; a, c &gt; = shufflevector m0, m1, &lt; 0, 2 &gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02156" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2156"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   t1 = &lt; b, d &gt; = shufflevector m0, m1, &lt; 1, 3 &gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02157" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2157"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02158" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2158"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// For matrices having greater than n columns, the resulting nx2 transposed</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2159"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// matrix is stored in two result vectors such that one vector contains</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02160" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2160"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// interleaved elements from all the even-numbered rows and the other vector</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02161" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2161"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// contains interleaved elements from all the odd-numbered rows. For example,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02162" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2162"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// a 2x4 matrix can be transposed with:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02163" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2163"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2164"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   ; Original matrix</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02165" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2165"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   m0 = &lt; a, b, c, d &gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02166" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2166"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   m1 = &lt; e, f, g, h &gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02167" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2167"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02168" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2168"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   ; Transposed matrix</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02169" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2169"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   t0 = &lt; a, e, c, g &gt; = shufflevector m0, m1 &lt; 0, 4, 2, 6 &gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02170" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2170"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   t1 = &lt; b, f, d, h &gt; = shufflevector m0, m1 &lt; 1, 5, 3, 7 &gt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02171" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2171"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> isTransposeMask(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;int&gt;</a> Mask, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumSrcElts);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02172" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2172" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/shufflevectorinst/#af6334dd1d66f3d23bc0d6f30c4eb104b"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">static</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/shufflevectorinst/#af6334dd1d66f3d23bc0d6f30c4eb104b">isTransposeMask</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/constant">Constant</a> &#42;Mask, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NumSrcElts) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02176" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2176"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/shufflevectorinst/#a9c89d6ee326837db1cf0876959acf9c8">isTransposeMask</a>(MaskAsInts, NumSrcElts);</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02179" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2179"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if this shuffle transposes the elements of its inputs without</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02192" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2192"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// This assumes that vector operands (of length \\p NumSrcElts) are the same</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2291"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if this shuffle mask represents &quot;clustered&quot; mask of size VF,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2292"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// i.e. each index between &#91;0..VF) is used exactly once in each submask of</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02322" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2322"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Return true if the mask interleaves one or more input vectors together.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02323" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2323"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02324" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2324"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// I.e. &lt;0, LaneLen, ... , LaneLen&#42;(Factor - 1), 1, LaneLen + 1, ...&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02327" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2327"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// E.g. For a Factor of 3 (LaneLen=4):</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02328" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2328"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///   &lt;4, 0, 9, 5, 1, 10, 6, 2, 11, 7, 3, 12&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02331" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2331"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l02332" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2332"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// NumInputElts is the total number of elements in the input vectors.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l02337" /><CodeLine lineNumber="2337"><Highlight kind="comment">  ///</Highlight></CodeLine>
